Art. 4.234. 
Gifts of present and future property 
A gift made in favour of the spouses or of one of them in their matrimonial agreement may be made cumulatively of present and future property, in whole or in part, provided that a statement of the donor's debts and liabilities existing on the date of the gift is annexed to the deed; in which case the donee is free, on the donor's death, to confine himself to the present property, renouncing the donor's surplus property.
If the statement referred to in paragraph 1 has not been appended to the deed containing the gift of present and future property, the donee is obliged to accept or repudiate the gift in its entirety. In the event of acceptance, he may only claim the property existing on the day of the donor's death, and he is subject to the payment of all the debts and charges of the succession.
